news.title: Trump says Kevin Warsh is at top of Fed chair candidate list, president should be consulted on rates
news.summary: Trump says Kevin Warsh has moved to the top of his list as the next Federal Reserve chair. Others remain in contention for the job.

news.title: Financial fraud cost older adults up to $81.5 billion in 2024, FTC estimates — more are losing at least $100,000
news.summary: From 2020 to 2024, the 60-plus age group's reported losses have jumped 300% to $2.4 billion from $600 million.

news.title: 'Stranger Things' ushered in a new era for Netflix
news.summary: Netflix has announced dozens of "Stranger Things" partnerships and collaborations with brands. A lot has changed since its first season in 2016, as Netflix has announced more partnerships.

news.title: Trump expected to sign executive order to reclassify marijuana as soon as Monday, source tells CNBC; pot stocks surge
news.summary: Trump expected to sign executive order to reclassify marijuana as soon as Monday. Trump expected to signs executive order on reclassifying marijuana on Monday.

news.title: Trump says 'no big deal' after Jeffrey Epstein photos showing him released
news.summary: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee released the photos to pressure the Trump administration to release files about Jeffrey Epstein. The photos were taken at Epstein's Florida mansion.

news.title: Regime change in Venezuela could bring boost in oil production — but not as much as you’d think
news.summary: It would take time and billions of dollars to fix Venezuela’s oil infrastructure, experts say. It would also take time to fix the country's economy, which is in freefall.

news.title: ‘The stress at my job is getting worse every day’: I’m 61, earn $177K, and have a 401(k) with $965K. Do I retire and downsize?
news.summary: “I don’t want to end up in a nursing home on Medicare like my grandma,” she says. “I’m not going to be like my grandmother.”

news.title: My Taiwanese immigrant friend started working in Walmart for minimum wage and retired with $2 million. What was her secret?
news.summary: “She owns two houses and lives with a disabled son,” says a friend of the victim. “She’s a good woman,’ the friend adds.

news.title: ‘This feels like an opportunity’: I’m 55, earn $78,000 and have no kids. My mother gave me $10,000. What should I do?
news.summary: “I also have $1,000 on a credit card, which will be paid in full next month,” she says.

news.title: ‘This seems absolutely insane’: Our children pay rent on our investment properties. Our lawyer says they should still buy us out.
news.summary: “They have already paid the mortgage. It makes no sense to require them to ‘pay’ it again,” he said.
